header.text: Every year, the Art Labyrinth Summer Festival gathers people ready to unite in search of inspiration, creativity, and mindfulness. In 2025, the festival will take place from July 10 to 13 on the picturesque banks of the Dniester River in the village of Poiana, Moldova, our most beloved and sunny place. We return here to once again create a space where art, music, and nature merge into one flow.

theme.text_1: Five Hands, One Rhythm is not just a name. It is a symbol of unity, creativity, and community. In a world full of unique individuals, only together can we create something greater. Five hands symbolize collective action, weaving various energies and directions into one harmonious and powerful force. Five hands are artists, musicians, craftsmen, dreamers, those who come to contribute their part to the big picture, creating a world without divisions.
theme.text_2: One rhythm is the heart of the festival. It is the beat that unites us all, providing space for creativity and mindfulness. It is the rhythm of life, reflected in every moment, every melody, and every movement. It is our goal — conscious creation, where every participant becomes part of something greater than themselves.

about.text_1: The Art Labyrinth Summer Festival is an annual event founded in 2008 and has since become a significant milestone in Moldova's cultural life. Every year, we choose a new location to create a unique atmosphere and connect people through art and music. But our place — Poiana, on the banks of the Dniester — has become our special corner, a place of power where nature and creativity meet.
about.text_2: We believe that the festival is not just a gathering of people. It is a space for transformation, exchange of ideas, and inspiration. At Art Labyrinth, everyone can unlock their potential, become part of a community, contribute to a common goal, and become a creator.
about.text_3: Our festival brings together different people — artists, musicians, craftsmen, volunteers, dreamers — all those ready to work in one rhythm and create something great. We invite you on a journey where every step is filled with mindfulness, every moment is harmony, and every person matters.

what.text_1: Live music and performances by local and international artists
what.text_5: Ecological initiatives and living in harmony with nature

end.text_1: Art Labyrinth is a place where the boundaries between art and life, between man and nature, between past and future disappear. It is a space for creation, inspiration, and self-expression.
end.text_2: Join us, become part of the festival, discover the rhythm of unity and creativity that will resonate in each of us.

form.header_1: Let's write the festival's story together!
form.header_2: You can ask us a question or leave a suggestion
form.name: Your name

error.title: Message sending error
error.text: Please check the entered data and try again.

hero.text: Art Labyrinth is not just a festival, but a space for live co-creation. There are no spectators or organizers here—everyone who attends the festival automatically becomes a participant. Participation is open to all and can take various forms: contributing to the cultural program, providing help to the festival with physical or intellectual skills, or offering financial support through donations.

texts_1: Helping each other and the festival
Creativity as a way of connection
texts_2: Consumption of alcohol or substances prohibited by law
Cooking meat over an open fire
Harming nature: cutting branches, bushes, or trees

traditions.title_3: Sustainability and respect for the Earth
traditions.text_1: Art Labyrinth is more than just a festival. It’s a living space where nature, art, inner journeys, and community come together.
traditions.text_2: The festival takes place on special astronomical days—full moon or solstice. These moments enhance the energetic and symbolic depth of the experience.
traditions.text_3: We choose untouched, wild landscapes. There’s no conventional infrastructure, and that’s part of the experience—living in a tent, under the stars, by a campfire. We step away from urban rhythms, noise, and visual clutter to return to simplicity.
traditions.text_4:
The festival is built on principles of sustainable and mindful presence:
— sorting waste and leaving no trace,
— using natural materials,
— avoiding plastic,
— eating vegetarian food,
— treating all living things with care.
traditions.text_5: The festival promotes sobriety—no alcohol or psychoactive substances. This is a space of clarity, depth, and presence. Here, we meet ourselves and others authentically.
traditions.text_6: There’s no division between 'organizers' and 'spectators'—everyone contributes. All infrastructure is created by participants: stages, art installations, kitchens, workshops. You can be part of this.
traditions.text_7: The program is filled with vibrant forms: music, theater, workshops, land art, performances. The Labyrinth is also a space for personal discoveries, inspiration, and reconnecting with yourself.
traditions.text_8: The festival exists thanks to people who believe in the value of unity, art, and nature. It’s a non-profit project created through collective efforts—time, actions, and support.

guest.text: Make a contribution and learn more about ways to support the festival.

titles.slider_1: Where is the festival held? How to get there?
titles.slider_3: Will food be provided, or should I cook myself?
titles.slider_4: Can I come by car? Will there be parking?
titles.slider_5: Will there be a place to charge phones?
titles.slider_6: Will there be mobile service or internet at the site?
titles.slider_7: Do I need to buy separate tickets for concerts and workshops?
titles.slider_10: How will safety be organized at the site?
titles.slider_11: What should I do if I need medical assistance?
titles.slider_13: Can I smoke at the festival?
titles.slider_16: Pot solicita returnarea contribuției? Cum funcționează politica de returnare?

texts.text_1: Each year, we choose a new location for the festival. This year, it will take place in the Șoldănești District, near the village of Poiana. You can get there in several ways. Please see the 'How to Get There' section for detailed information.
texts.text_2: You should bring: comfortable clothing for activities, personal items, insect repellent, a tent, a sleeping bag or mat, eating utensils if you plan to cook for yourself, and anything else needed for a comfortable stay in nature.
texts.text_3:
The festival will have several food points catering to different preferences:
Main kitchen—simple home-cooked meals prepared over a fire.
Vedic kitchen—traditional Indian dishes without onion, garlic, or mushrooms.
Raw food kitchen—healthy food without thermal processing.
Tea house—an atmospheric space with delicious herbal teas, coffee, and natural sweets.

You can also cook independently at your camp.
texts.text_4: Yes, you can arrive by car, but vehicles cannot enter the festival grounds. There will be a paid, guarded parking area.
texts.text_5: Phones can be charged at designated spots using electricity from a generator.
texts.text_6: Internet signal may be limited due to the remote location, but mobile service will be available in some areas.
texts.text_7: No, the festival contribution includes participation in all workshops, concerts, and performances.
texts.text_8: Yes, the festival will have shower cabins and eco-toilets.
texts.text_9: Yes, clean spring water will be available at the festival.
texts.text_10: During the festival, police will be on duty, and the Art Labyrinth team will ensure order and adherence to traditions.
texts.text_11: A duty medic and first aid kit will be available near the information center.
texts.text_12: No, bringing or consuming alcohol is not in line with the festival’s traditions.
texts.text_13: Smoking is prohibited in public areas and at main festival sites.
texts.text_14: Yes, you can bring pets, but they must remain under your control.
texts.text_15: Of course! Art Labyrinth places great emphasis on families and children. A large children’s area with a varied program will be provided for kids.
texts.text_16: The contribution can be refunded under the following conditions: 80% refund if requested 3 weeks before the festival, 50% refund if requested 2 weeks before, no refund for requests made less than 2 weeks before. Refunds will be processed after the festival once all documentation is completed.

org.text: Want to join the team and make a contribution? Fill out the form and join us!

titles.slider_3: What roles are available for volunteers?
titles.slider_4: Do I need to pay to participate as a volunteer?
titles.slider_5: What does the festival provide for volunteers?
titles.slider_6: How many hours do I need to work?
titles.slider_7: Can I volunteer for just one day?
titles.slider_8: Can I change roles during the festival?
titles.slider_9: What should I bring with me?
titles.slider_11: Can I come with a friend who also wants to help?
titles.slider_12: When will I know if I have been accepted?
titles.slider_13: Who should I contact if I have questions?

texts.text_1: Anyone who sincerely wants to help the festival! Anyone can become a volunteer, especially those who cannot pay the contribution but are ready to invest their time and effort.
texts.text_2: Fill out the form on the website, and we will contact you.
texts.text_3:
The application includes a list of main tasks and functions. During the festival, there are also one-time tasks such as:
– meeting and registering participants,
– helping in the kitchen,
– maintaining cleanliness and order,
– assisting masters and artists,
– supporting the children's area,
– photo/video documentation,
– fire watch duties,
– helping in the tea house,
– technical assistance on stages, and much more.
A complete list of tasks is available in the application and discussed individually.
texts.text_4: No. Volunteering is your contribution to the festival.
texts.text_5:
The festival provides:
– entry to the festival,
– food and rewards for deeper involvement.
texts.text_6: A minimum of 4 hours per day.
texts.text_7: To gain entry to the festival, you need to volunteer for at least 2 days.
texts.text_8: Yes, just contact your volunteer coordinator.
texts.text_9: Personal items for living in wild conditions (tent, sleeping bag, and everything necessary).
texts.text_10: Yes, food is provided for deeper involvement.
texts.text_11: Yes, but please fill out the application in advance for each of you.
texts.text_12: Your coordinator will contact you after submitting the application.

master.text: Want to be part of the festival’s magic? Fill out the form and showcase your creativity at Art Labyrinth!
Want to be part of the festival’s magic? Fill out the form and showcase your creativity at Art Labyrinth!

titles.slider_5: When can I expect a response?
titles.slider_10: Can I conduct something outside the program?

texts.text_1: Any master, artist, musician, or teacher who wants to share knowledge, art, or inspiration. The main thing is to align with the spirit of the festival: respect, eco-friendliness, depth, and creativity.
texts.text_2: Fill out the form on the website, and a coordinator will contact you.
texts.text_3: Yes, you can! If you offer several different formats (for example, yoga and a lecture, or a musical workshop and a dance), you need to fill out a separate form for each. If the workshop is repeated, it is enough to indicate that number in one form.
texts.text_4: The cultural program is formed according to the concept, traditions, spirit, and values of the festival.
texts.text_5: Within 3 days after submitting the application, the coordinator will contact you.
texts.text_6: There is no entry fee for participants in the cultural program. This is your contribution to the festival.
texts.text_7:
Participation conditions for creators:
🔹 Masters and lecturers

Beginners and enthusiasts — free entry to the festival, food on the day of the workshop, support in our media.
Experienced masters — free entry, food for all festival days, promotion and announcements.

🔹 Musicians, artists, performers

Young and promising — free entry, food on the day of performance, promotion in media.
Famous artists — free entry, food, advertising and support.
Headliners — free entry, food, reimbursement of travel expenses, fee (by prior agreement and if resources are available).

✨ Important: The festival is not a commercial project. We strive to share resources honestly and fairly so that everyone who invests their heart receives feedback and support. If you have special needs, please write to us — we will find a solution together.
texts.text_8: Yes, but please notify your coordinator in advance.
texts.text_9: Fill out the form with your technical rider — we will try to accommodate your requests.
texts.text_10: Yes! There are experimental venues for this purpose, but the program still needs to be agreed upon with the coordinator.
texts.text_11: Yes, we have a Masters' Shop where you can present and sell your products.

hero_1.text_2: The festival exists thanks to mutual support. Here you will find all the ways to do it.

hero_2.text: The festival is not a product, but a joint creation. Every participation of yours is part of a living mosaic. Thank you for your support.

pricing.motto: I make a contribution and become part of the creation
pricing.text: The contribution is an investment in the common reality. We do not sell tickets - we support the space we create together. Your contribution can be made in cash at the festival or online by card.
warnings: From July 1, the contribution can only be made at the festival entrance — 800 lei.
tiraspol: Residents of Transnistria: Loznîskaia Liubov Viktorovna
In the transfer comment — indicate your name and email (or send this information to Liuba in Telegram)
pricing.note: Select the type of contribution that suits you below. If you cannot afford the contribution, choose the 'Complex situation' option and briefly describe your situation in the form.

column_1.title: I go to the festival
column_1.text: Free entry for children under 14 years old

column_3.title: Family
column_3.text: Families (minimum 1 parent and child up to 18 years old) receive a 25% discount on the contribution. Children under 14 years old enter for free.

column_4.title: Complex situation
column_4.text: If you have a special case and would like to contribute less - briefly and clearly state your situation.

form.name: Your name
form.lastname: Last name (Please provide your family's real last name)
form.message: Briefly and clearly describe your situation.

post_form.grateful: We are grateful for your support and participation in creating the festival.
post_form.link_text: To pay online, use the link below:
post_form.terminal: Or pay in cash through any Bpay terminal
post_form.detail: An email has been sent to you with your order ID and instructions for cash payment through Bpay terminals.
post_form.spam: If the email did not arrive — check your 'Spam' folder or contact us.
post_form.special_text: Thank you for your trust. We understand that everyone may have special circumstances. Your application has been received, and we will contact you soon to discuss possible ways to participate.

help_us.text_1: Want such events to continue? You can simply make a contribution. We will be grateful for any support.
help_us.text_2: You can also contact the festival coordinator for a personal meeting or cash support.

our_needs.header_3: What we especially need right now
our_needs.text_1: What we especially need right now:
our_needs.text_2: We are looking for partners ready to support the festival with resources, goods, advertising, or participation. We offer transparency, recognition, and a creative promotion format.
our_needs.text_3: If you can share something — write to us, we will be very grateful!
our_needs.text_4: Always open to partnership and collaboration
list: Fabrics for decoration, cushions, ribbons, paints

back: Soldanesti → Chisinau: 5:15 - 16:30 every 20-30 min (last at 15:40 and 16:30)

by_car.title: By Car or Hitchhiking
by_car.subtitle: Route: Chisinau → Orhei → Rezina → Soldanesti → Alcedar → Poiana.
directions: After Orhei, turn left at the fork to Soldanesti
At the end of Soldanesti turn right (towards Shestachi, Vadul-Rashkov, Kamenka)
Stay on the main road, turn left through Alcedar to Poiana, another 3 km
At the entrance to Poiana, landmark — drawings of swans and roe deer, turn right
by_car.parking: There will be a paid guarded parking at the festival site with round-the-clock duty!
by_car.price: 50 lei - per day; 75 lei - 2 days; 100 lei - 3 days.

zones: 11 zones including Main Stage, Small Stage, Mastergrad, Yoga Zone, Shambala, Sport Zone, Tea House, Main Bonfire, Bedouin Tent, Children Zone, Art Gallery.
fantacy_space: + Fantasy Zone (for fans of myths and fairy worlds)
kitchens: + Vegetarian, Raw Food, and Indian cuisines
changes: Minor changes possible and can be found in the festival schedule.
